DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study : 1 . Determine whether Physical Therapy ( PT ) & Fitbit® intervention proceed full-scale clinical trial . This decision base three hypothesis : Treatment promise ( Hypothesis 1A ) : People PT & Fitbit® walk 1250 steps/day spend 7 min/day moderate vigorous physical activity ( MVPA ) control discharge 6 month , Safety ( Hypothesis 1B ) : < 5 % adverse event intervention , Recruitment ( Hypothesis 1C ) : 75 recruit , 90 % complete trial , 85 % complete visit 6 month . 2 . To evaluate short- long-term adherence PT & Fitbit® intervention . Short-term Adherence ( Hypothesis 2A ) : 90 % subject PT & Fitbit® group wear Fitbit® participate goal set behavioral counseling PT . Long-term Adherence ( Hypothesis 2B ) : 75 % PT & Fitbit® wear Fitbit® 6 month . 3 . To quantify change potential underlying mechanism increase physical activity . Hypothesis 3 : Change self-efficacy physical activity , walk endurance participation daily activity associate improvement physical activity .
DOC.brief_title: Fitbit® Based Physical Activity Intervention After Total Knee Replacement ( TKR )
DOC.detailed_description: The study pilot study determine feasibility full trial .
DOC.criteria: Over age 45 Seeking outpatient physical therapy unilateral TKR Not interested increase physical activity Comorbidities unilateral TKR limit physical activity Planning another low extremity surgery next 6 month Have another low extremity surgery past 6 month
